fields.headline: President Trump
fields.bodyText: Donald Trump took the oath of office and gave a short, aggressively populist speech that also decried “the crime and the gangs and the drugs that have stolen too many lives”. “This American carnage stops right here and stops right now,” he said. Morning in America carnage 20 January 2017 will be remembered as the day the people became the rulers of this nation again. The forgotten men and women of our country will be forgotten no longer. Everyone is listening to you now. – Donald Trump Trump speech text Barack and Michelle Obama received the Trumps at the White House. They hosted the Trumps for tea, attended the swearing-in and then boarded a helicopter and headed off on holiday. Clinton stoic Spectators lined the post-swearing-in parade route from the Capitol to the White House but the crowd was notably small in comparison with Obama’s. The contrast was most visible on the National Mall, during the swearing-in. Adorable Deplorables It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please consider joining us by becoming a member for only $6.99 a month. Thanks for reading! Become a Guardian member More than 95 people were arrested in Washington in protest-related activity, police said. Police used teargas and smoke and noise devices. A car, a limo and trash cans were set on fire. Protesters clash with police
